brief_summary.textblock:
Although thrombocytopenia has been reported as a risk factor for patent ductus arterioses,
      there is lack of data on the function of platelets in ductal closure. Information on
      functions of platelets in ductal closure may change the known model for ductus arterioses
      and may affect the treatment modalities.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Impact of Platelet Functions on Spontaneous Ductal Closure in Preterm Infants

detailed_description.textblock:
Patent ductus arterioses is a common problem which involves both pulmonary and cardiac
      outcomes in preterm infants. Although thrombocytopenia has been reported as a risk factor
      for patent ductus arterioses, there is lack of data on the function of platelets in ductal
      closure.

      The investigators aim to investigate the relation between thrombocytopenia and platelet
      functions in pathogenesis of spontaneous ductal closure. The investigators hypothesize that
      Information on functions of platelets in ductal closure may change the known model for
      ductus arterioses and may affect the treatment modalities.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  gestational age lower than 30 weeks and birth weight lower than 1500 g

          -  obtained informed consent

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  any received medical treatment in first 2 days of life

          -  death in first 2 days

          -  patients who received any thrombocyte or fresh frozen plasma suspensions

          -  any known genetic thrombocyte disorder in the family

study_pop.textblock: preterm infants with gestational age below 30 weeks and birth weght lower than 1500 g

clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of Platelet Count, Platelet Mass Index and Platelet Function Evaluated by Platelet Function Analyzer (PFA-100) on Spontaneous Ductal Closure in Preterm Infants

primary_outcome.description: ductal closure confirmed by echocardiography on postnatal 2-3 days

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: any need for medical treatment (ibuprofen or paracetamol) or surgical treatment

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
